website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking to upgrade your existing cable-Internet-based home network, or start anew, the Motorola SBG6782-AC is currently the most complete and advanced all-in-one modem-router combo you can get. Non-cable users need not apply.
pros: The Motorola SBG6782-AC Surfboard eXtreme offers high-end hardware components and good overall performance
The built-in support for MoCA is a useful extra
cons: The device is perhaps bulky enough to defeat the purpose of having a combo device, its Wi-Fi speed could use some improvement over long range, and the ridiculously lengthy name can be a headache during the modem setup process

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a SBG6782 purchased three years ago. Worked fine until it didn't. Now it's discontinued, beware because they are still selling them and offer no support whatsoever. My download speed has dropped to almost zero and my ISP is telling me I need a new modem. Not wanting to take their advice totally I've been trying to find out from Arris if this is possible. Thought I was buying top of the line for my needs and it should have lasted more than 3 years. My biggest complaint is not being able to contact Arris. Since it's discontinued, I can't even ask a question. No more Arris products for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kismetski

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me I'm Afraid
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble with this and a previous model allowing too many of my peripheral devices that should remain connected to suddenly disconnect and not wish to reconnect (wi-fi camera's specifically). While this is sleek and stylish - I found it (and the lower grade prior model very hinky and returned it as I expect things to work properly without a lot of time and effort. This required too much. For a highly rated unit, this - to me, is far inferior to the stand alone Motorola DOCSIS 3 - Surfboard modem and Apple Airport Extreme combo I have been using and went back to
customer_reviews.author: rj1118

customer_reviews.title: ... had one with N technology and I wanted to enjoy the benefits of AC technology so I bought one ...
customer_reviews.text: I had one with N technology and I wanted to enjoy the benefits of AC technology so I bought one with 5G capacity. At fist, i noticed that it was slower than my older one. I was forced to watch a movie in 480p because it wouldn't work another way. even when I had it right next to my tv. I bought another AC one to replace it. no problems since I install it. that confirmed how bad this product is. do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: luis

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY PLEASE READ IF YOU WANT TO SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Wow really really bad do not buy. Months of slow internet, I kept upgrading my internet service and didn't get any better quality internet after months of this, I call Tech support through some trial and error we found out that the router only runs 100 mbps Way lower than the 300 it claims it can do. Please save your money this really is only worth about 25-35 dollars. SO NOT WORH THE 150$ Go buy another reliable brand on here for 50$ it will be way better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Don't wast your money
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours reading reviews and researching different cable modem/routers. I purchased this one due to the info provided by the manufacturer and consumer reviews. WHAT A MISTAKE. The Wi-Fi range on this unit is worse then they say, I can be in the next room and get kicked offline. I have a Xbox One directly connected via a Cat5 Cable and get dropped. I have the Cox Premium Internet Pkg with 100mbs speed and this unit can't come close to proving me half of it. I had to purchase a separate modem and router (Netgear) to finally resolve the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend buying your own instead
customer_reviews.text: If you have Comcast and currently rent your modem/router, I highly recommend buying your own instead. I rented one from Comcast for 3 years before I finally decided enough is enough. This SURFboard works perfectly. The internet speed is faster than my previously rented modem. The set up was fairly easy (depending on your Comcast agent). Make sure you order a new device because Comcast will register this modem to your account before it gets activated. I spent about an hour with Comcast to get things switched over. All in all it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: B. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Cons: It is combo of cable modem and router. There is single piece of equipment. Cons: 1. When I used with Comcast, it drop connection almost once a week or more. It seems some hardware issue as other s mentioned. Only way out in this case is powering off and on. 2. I have 200Mbps Comcast. The effective speed I get is 60Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: V. Naik

customer_reviews.title: Terrible WIFI reliability
customer_reviews.text: I have used this router for 10 months now. I finally gave up and connected my Archer 7 via Ethernet so I could use it as my WIFI generator and I turned off the WIFI in the Arris. I only use the Arris as a Cable modem now. The whole family (of 5) immediately experienced an improvement in speed and consistency. I contacted Arris 5 times over the 10 months. They take no responsibility and refused to allow me to return this terrible router. A true shame. I will never purchase another Arris.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good start but concerned!
customer_reviews.text: Previous Motorola SBG6580 gateway (modem/router) combination lasted almost two years before the wireless portion went out. I had concerns with purchasing another of their products. I did a great deal of review reading by both consumer agencies as well as those by actual customers. It is my hope that this one will last longer. Easy to set up and configure. So far running like a dream. I will update this if issues surface.
customer_reviews.author: AtoZ-Consumer

customer_reviews.title: great performance - horrible administration
customer_reviews.text: router performance seems to be good, speed seems to be good, connection seems to be reliable but the administration pages are the very worst I have seen in 15 years of dealing with home routers. ARRIS needs to throw away the entire management console and start from scratch to make it useful. I had to spend hours reconfiguring my wireless cameras to use a different network segment because this device CANOOT use 192.168.100.x for some reason. I lost probably 8-10 hours time messing with it reconfiguring everything again, then resetting then trying again etc. before finally giving up and unmounting all of my wi-fi cameras to bring to the router to reconfigure them.
customer_reviews.author: Yesitsmedoug

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Product That Works Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: The Arris Surfboard modem works flawlessly with our Cox Communications Internet and HDTV service. This particular modem was suggested as one that would work with Cox Communications and it has done so without a problem. I would not hesitate to purchase this, or any, Motorola/Arris modem because you will get a quality product. The only problem we experienced was the incorrect provisioning of the modem by Cox when they input the incorrect serial number into their system. I can't blame Arris for Cox errors. Once the correct information was entered by Cox, the internet and HDTV service has performed without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Mike the Engineer

customer_reviews.title: An utter waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This modem-router is garbage. I don't understand why so many sites recommend them - I guess it's because they use them for a short time and don't see how they perform over longer periods. When it works, it works great. Unfortunately, after a few weeks, our wifi network started vanishing at least once a day - it would kick certain devices or just disappear altogether. We sent it back to Amazon, thinking it was a defective unit, and reordered a new one, which did the same thing. This one even spontaneously resets itself to factory conditions. Customer service at Motorola has been unhelpful and rude. We will never purchase another Motorola modem or router again after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Parmenides

customer_reviews.title: Call your cable tech support if you have slow speeds
customer_reviews.text: Speeds seemed to be at dial up. Gave it a couple of days. Was really getting ticked for spending $200. Did a speedtest.net (ping 2272/Download 0.23/Upload 0.06). Called Cable One. Tech said, "Your modem is still at registration speeds, let me reset it." BAM! internet became lightning fast. Did a speed test again, ping 52/Download 56.86/Upload 3.09. Set up was very easy, no problems whatsoever. Tried to activate through Firefox on Cable One (which is an acceptable browser), but it did not. Opened internet explorer and the activation process started. It seems modems now come with a predefined password for that modem. I did change my password to something to remember off the top of my head.
customer_reviews.author: gsc

customer_reviews.title: Very dissappointing!
customer_reviews.text: Not overly impressed. Connection speeds worse than before on all systems with 2.4GHz. PS4 lost over half it's connection speed. I had high hopes for this but looks like I'm out $150 for mediocre results. I will say that set up was a breeze. Update: Now nothing can connect to the internet for longer than 1 to 3 minutes without being kicked. Complete waste of money. Do NOT buy this expecting for an easy option. Ended up buying Netgear cable modem, wireless router and wifi extender. Had all 3 up and running within an half hours with over double the speed for most of my devices. All 3 products cost me less than the Arris SURFboard.
customer_reviews.author: cefu63

customer_reviews.title: Installed easily and delivered all it said it would
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily and delivered all it said it would. I have absolutely no problems tailoring this device for my use and no interface problems with Comcast. I really like the admin menus. They are both informative and intuetive to use. I am using both the wireless access (for my guests, our iOS devices as well as our printers) and the wired ports (for my Mac OS desktop devices). All is playing very nicely together. I can use my AirDrop and print from any device to the wireless connected printer. Actually, on my desktops I am running both wired and wireless at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: It broke, and it's WAY too much work to get ARRIS to replace it, so I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working suddenly, after only a few months. The Comcast service tech tested the device, said it was fried and temporarily rented me a Comcast modem so I could continue service while ARRIS replaced mine. I finally located ARRIS customer service number (not easy) and the tech said that in order for them to replace the device, I would have to call Comcast and have them re-establish the device as my modem and then call ARRIS again and troubleshoot it over the phone. I have already wasted an hour on the phone with Comcast, followed by four hours waiting for a Comcast appointment, I'm not inclined to waste any further time on this modem. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Reiter

customer_reviews.title: Tired of Rebooting to Get an Internect Connection
customer_reviews.text: Bought this modem 5 months ago. Now I am back looking for a different modem. I am tired of the more than weekly need to reboot to keep an internet connection. I really thought this was going to be great and I would save a lot of money vs the Comcast rental fee. At least the modem from Comcast never gave me any trouble. Lately the problems have been more frequent. Not really sure why, but I get a good wifi connection which drops the internet. I think next I will get a modem and a stand alone wifi router.
customer_reviews.author: docinabox

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer but it died after 17 months
customer_reviews.text: This modem/router was very easy to install. The WiFi signal is strong, reaching well outside our home. Adjusting settings is easy and well laid out. So far we've only had to reboot the router once. That was then. This is now: after 17 months of use the modem has crapped out. It started requiring daily restarts to reconnect to the internet; it finally escalated to a reboot every few hours. It's now in the trash bin, replaced by a Netgear high-rated modem ($80 cheaper) and a stand-alone wifi router (Apple AirPort Extreme which doubles as a automatic backup drive).
customer_reviews.author: Wally S

customer_reviews.title: This router is great If you only want Wifi across the house and ...
customer_reviews.text: This router is great If you only want Wifi across the house and basic service. The 5Ghz and 2.4Ghz coverage are really good. I wouldn't recommend this one if you need a more advanced setup or if you play on-line games a lot. The DHCP service of the router is poor, and very frequently it doesn't assign the mapped IPs to Mac addresses. In my case, I need to go into the router's configuration site 3-4 times a week to redo DHCP reserved addresses to ensure IP ports and DMZ configuration works. Not fun for an expensive router.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wollmann

customer_reviews.title: or do and get duped like I did
customer_reviews.text: ive had this modem/router for 1 month and it just STOPPED working out of nowhere. Ive had my ISP send a tech to make sure it wasn't a problem on their end. The tech said that the modem wasnt comunicating properly and to send it back....and of course the return window closed YESTERDAY....so NO, do not get this product, or do and get duped like I did. Now im stuck with this broken modem and out almost 200.00$ plus what im gonna have to spend to get a new DIFFERENT modem. P.S. aside from this modem just up and deciding to stop working, it did work great up until that point.
customer_reviews.author: wombat876

customer_reviews.title: Xfinity Customers, you can't go wrong!!!
customer_reviews.text: Setting up this modem, myself, was a breeze. I had the Xfinity installer run me a cable from the box outside into my attic, where I had a cable I pre-installed from my closet. After the installer connected the cable, which I had allready connected to my ARRIS Surfboard, All I had to do was select the SSID for the modem, enter it's WI-FI security key (both printed on the bottom of the modem), then enter the passkey formerly emailed to me from Xfinity. From using my home cloud via wifi to surfing the net on my PC, tablets, cell phones are quite flawless. I would highly recommend this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Xfertime

customer_reviews.title: After that all work just great!
customer_reviews.text: It's not often that a product exceeds my expectations but this one did. I had just switched internet providers and the wireless signal from the provider did not reach the whole house - 1500 square feet one level. I returned it and bought the Arris SURFboard modem/router. It not only reaches the whole house but the signal is the maximum that I can get. One word of advise; call your provider prior to installation of the modem/router to give them it's id numbers, etc. Then call them after the installation if you have any issues. I initially did not receive a signal and the tech had to do a restart. After that all work just great!
customer_reviews.author: Ishmael Z. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router!
customer_reviews.text: The router arrived on time. Packaging was in the original box. The router was larger than expected but so far it has been excellent. The range is fantastic. I am using it in an Airstream park in the mountains that is located among the pines and have no problems staying connected throughout my property and significantly beyond. I am very pleased. I brought it to my local ISP and they provisioned in on the spot. Came to the property, plugged it in and set up my wireless network to mirror the one at home so that SSID and passwords were the same. Everything started working with no problems. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tucson Bob

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the negative comments, This is better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit concerned by some of the negative comments. The installation went smoothly, the only part that was not so smooth was waiting for the customer support to activate the modem on Comcast. There was only one concern when I was trying to login to the modem the default password was different than the documentation said. I found the correct one by going to the Arris site and downloading the how to video. This modem has more power and bells and whistles than I expected, not in a bad way either. So far it is everything I had hoped to get from it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: STATE OF THE ART TECHNOLOGY
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU HAVE COMCAST THIS IS YOUR ROUTER/Modem you need to get to get rid of the Xtra unsecure signal that your paying for...I did ALOT of research before purchasing and with this userfriendly device I can easily customize my settings..with the echnicolor I was always dropping signal BUT NOT WITH THIS ARRIS MODEL..IN MY OPINION THIS IS STATE OF THE ART TECHNOLOGY FOR A VERY GOOD PRICE...it will pay for itself in a years time and I have GREAT perfomance with my connection now..and they have a 800 customer support and 2 year guarantee...one purchase I did right...set up was EASY too so how can you go wrong
customer_reviews.author: LISA KORCEK

customer_reviews.title: Better figure this out quick because Amazon abandons you after ...
customer_reviews.text: This modem is over engineered and does its job too well. It has a very strong antenna which picks up interference from all of your neighbors and results in a wifi connection that is intermittent. called ISP and motorola who both told me there was nothing I could do accept move my office within my home. Sorry Moto, i bought this product to specifically address this issue because it is marketed as strong beam. My old Netgear delivers a much wider signal. Lost signal from Arris Surfboard after 20 feet. If you have walls between your computer and the surfboard, forget about it. Better figure this out quick because Amazon abandons you after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Pencil Queen

customer_reviews.title: 4 while I have devices like cell phones and ipads on the 5
customer_reviews.text: 2 channels. 2.4 and 5.0. The 5.0 is fast and the 2.4 does cover a longer distance. I have my computers and an extender on the 2.4 while I have devices like cell phones and ipads on the 5.0. Family of 3. Have had no major shutdowns. Handles multiple computers and devices with multiple browsers while streaming music simultaneously. Definitely an upgrade from my Surfboard sbg6580 which struggled to handle multiple devices. Pretty easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen F. Sharkins III

customer_reviews.title: The replacement unit was easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Fast connection and strong wifi coverage. The only problem is it occasionally makes noise, as if it has a hard disk inside. It does not seem to impact performance, but I asked for a replacement. The replacement unit was easy to setup, since I had a configuration backup from the old unit. However, it has the same noise issue. i will use it for awhile and see if it is just an annoyance or a real problem.
customer_reviews.author: P. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because it is on Cox communication acceptable devices and had good reviews. It has both 2.4 and 5 Ghz bandwidth and scanning the WiFi with your device(s) shows both available BUT the 5Ghz seems to be unstable so if you pick the 5Ghz network, it accepts it and works fine for a while then I notice slow performance and go back to networks and it dropped to 2.4Ghz network which I don't understand why.It becomes annoying if you have to constantly find the 5Ghz network and connect to it again and again. If someone knows a fix, I would love to hear the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Sachimo

customer_reviews.title: Support sucks $$
customer_reviews.text: Product is good but service is a rip-off! I went online to change the network name & password and followed the written instructions that came with the modem: enter IP address, enter the given login and the given password (which was "password"). Couldn't log in, so I finally called customer support, had to pay $30.00 and followed customer supports instructions: enter IP address, enter the given login and the password was "motorola". From there I could continue on my own as Support wanted another 10.00 for each step of help! Honestly, I was "this close" to returning this piece and never buy Motorola products again!
customer_reviews.author: Inkklex

customer_reviews.title: The replacement worked great after I called my internet provider and gave them ...
customer_reviews.text: The first surfboard I purchased would not work for the technician that tried to install it. I called Arris and they told me I would have to pay the return postage for replacement but also told me that Amazon would probably replace it as it was defective right out of the box. Amazon replaced it with no problems and sent a prepaid return label for the defective one. The replacement worked great after I called my internet provider and gave them the necessary information to connect it. I am very pleased with this modem and the service I received.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Kilbourn

customer_reviews.title: Unusable. It its dropping connections between the switch/router and ...
customer_reviews.text: Update: I found that Googledrive was syncing files. The perf monitor showed an average of +-%50 of the 100Mb/s link on my laptop, I had connected to the copper port. This traffic cause all of my connections issues. It's disappointing that the switch portion of the device couldn't handle this little bit of background traffic. Unusable. It its dropping connections between the switch/router and all of my devices. If I ping the router IP or if i ping from the router to the devices it drops most packets. Not sure what I'm going to do about it, but I tried to work from home today and it basically destroyed all my productivity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fast modem, easy to install, no problems at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to replace myand it was very easy to install + noticeably faster for wifi and ethernet to thunderbolt connection. For some reason, Time Warner Internet will only permit this modem to download at 100 Mbps. I clocked this modem at 117 Mbps. I'm not a gamer, I use a wired connection to my smart tv for streaming, and also a wired connection to my laptop for school. This modem's wifi also has a longer range. I've found zero problems with this modem thus far, and I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Justman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just received yesterday and hooked up today with Time Warner Cable. A couple of things learned: 1. TWC will ask for MAC ID: give them the "HFC MAC ID" not the "GATEWAY MGMT MAC ID" > caused some confusion and extended my install time since the last digit on each of these were different. 2. To get onto the Gateway Web Manager the default password is "motorola" NOT "password" 3. Set up Parental Controls for entire house to turn off modem at 10:30 pm to 5:30 am and it seems to work just fine. Not hard to do at all. What a BEAUTIFUL thing for kids and electronics ! So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Snowy Days

customer_reviews.title: Arris/Motorola Surfboard Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: This modem provided faster service as soon as I installed it. I use Comcast Blast internet service. I did have to call Comcast and give then the MAC numbers. This is a standard requirement that service providers need to make sure your modem has access to their signal. The wireless system uses two radio frequencies; one is best for older devices, the 5+g works for newer wireless devices. This modem uses the newest protocol presently released but is also backwards compatible for devices using older protocols. I am not a "teckie" so ease of install is important. Also this unit is a modem and router combined.
customer_reviews.author: BTP

customer_reviews.title: Best Home Modem on the Planet
customer_reviews.text: Finally I own my own modem and I don't have to pay any rental fees. the only draw back is that you cannot us home phone. It turns out that no provider will allow any all in one modem to have phone. it's ok as I found out how to get free home phone with google voice.
customer_reviews.author: P. Alouidor

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Modem Router , Beam Technology is a grat advancment keeping devices connected without loosing connection.
customer_reviews.text: Solved my Wireless problems , I was having problems with wireless connection with my devices PS4 gaming console kept disconnection and freezing up during game play with other players on the network server because the streaming on my old wireless router was stealing the show. My laptop is also running 100% better really like this Arris Surfboard also great customer service. I had a few setting problems, Motorola Arris Technical Support team helped my out with great satisfaction. All Wireless problems are now gone and all wireless devices are working great.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Johnson

customer_reviews.title: and the signal for the computers is excellent, which are on the first floor about 30 ...
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this ARRIS in my basement above my ceiling tiles as centered in home as a possible, and the signal for the computers is excellent, which are on the first floor about 30 ft. from the Surfboard. I have two computers, plus TV's connected to this unit. The TV's are direct wired to avoid any buffering. In saying that, before hard wiring I did try wireless and the surfboard did a pretty good job that way as well. Very satisfied with this modem/ Wi Fi router.
customer_reviews.author: DJ DAN

customer_reviews.title: Step 1 in cutting the cord, get faster WiFi and this will definitely do it
customer_reviews.text: You're going to love this once you have it up and running. Set your wifi to 5G and you will really love it. Remember, it will most likely take a call to your internet tech support to get it set-up, just tell them you have a new modem and they'll want the MAC ID and you should be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great price, easy install, never drops connections!
customer_reviews.text: For the reasonable price, ease of installation, and consistent connectivity, this is a great combo(cable modem/wi-fi router) package. I bought this to replace an earlier Arris SURFboard (model SBG6580) which had constant wi-fi connectivity issues. The documentation (both manual and online help) for setup and web based Manager (router admin tool) has been helpful and instructional. It took me about 15 minutes to replace the 6580 with this 6782-AC and haven't been disappointed with its performance yet. Kuddos to Team Arris!
customer_reviews.author: Marc F.

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for connection issues, you've come to the right place!
customer_reviews.text: Modem has significant connection issues with Time Warner. When it's connected the speeds are very fast. When its connected. Make sure you check your upstream bonded channel and ensure the power is above 40. Manufacturer recommends between 40 & 53 for stable connection. I had the provider out to my home to check for issues. Even after replacement of all wiring within my home it still does remain connected. Best part is that it's taken longer than 30 days to troubleshoot the issues and its no longer eligible for return. Don't waste your money on this. AVOID THE COMBO ROUTER\MODEMS!
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Ok modem when it's alive...
customer_reviews.text: Modem was great while it lasted. Purchased December 2014. Did not make it passed three years. As of today, 11/08/17 does not light up or power on. Dead modem. Warranty was only until March 2017 : ( Checkd with Arris Tech support... they can't do anything due to warranty being up. Phone assistance would be $39 due to warranty being out. Maybe we just got a faulty modem...
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on all of the reviews. The internet can be spotty, even in my 600 sq. foot apartment. My Xbox 360 does not connect to it via WiFi and I just expected more out of it. When watching shows in Netflix, it will struggle to maintain connection in the room adjacent to the unit. The same applies for Hulu. I have the Premiere internet plan from Cox and have talked to them multiple times and even had someone come out to ensure everything on their end is working properly so it isn't the cable provider. All in all it is no more than a decent product. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended...
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile, powerful and excellent usability. In addition to the typical cable modem features, such as WAN connection, gigabit router and Wi-Fi, the MoCA or "Multimedia over Coax" is an amazing tool. I now have a live WAN connection at every coax wall outlet in my house. Imagine that, a house wired for for network access without extra wiring. And the unit has been rock solid for me. The only issues or resets required are due to my cable provider and not the modem. No more monthly fee to the cable company for renting their modem! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gene K.

customer_reviews.title: Cord isn't white
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (open-package) in order to not pay for a Time Warner Cable (NY) unit for a newly registered service. It works well enough and I haven't had any issues with it. I like that it is all white and that it was easy to mount above a baseboard (supported by the base board and attached to the wall using the end of a ribbon picture hook drilled into the wall, end turned to secure the modem). Just wish the cord were also white.
customer_reviews.author: E Y.

customer_reviews.title: Poor 5Ghz wireless performance
customer_reviews.text: The 2.4Ghz band works perfectly fine. The 5Ghz band however continually drops connections across a variety of devices (laptops, smart phones, etc.). I've tried changing the broadcast channel multiple times but haven't seen a reduction in dropped connections. Wired performance is solid with no real issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just do it, you'll be glad you did
customer_reviews.text: great router/modem with LOTS of capability! I only use it to make 50% of its capabilities, but this modem/router can do a ton of stuff and I no longer have to pay the dumb cable company a rental fee every month to use theirs. 10 months of no rental fee and you've gotten a return on your purchase. Every month after that is just saved money going in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: 92Roadster

customer_reviews.title: Buy this modem and router in one! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router and modem in one. Unless you are doing really high tech things you don't need the modem and router in separate boxed (I.e., if you don't know what I'm talking about you don't need it). I shopped around a lot and asked friends who know more about tech than I do. One recommended this router as a middle tier (upper price point of the tier) and I'm very grateful. We get signal everywhere in our house and have 2 stories.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with TWC in my region
customer_reviews.text: I have time warner cable NorthEast and the modem is not compatible with their service. I spent an hour trying to get this thing to prioritize with the customer service agent and he finally told me that the modem isn't compatible. The SBG6782 was not on their list. He suggested I buy the SBG6700 ro SBG6900. The thing that kills me is that the box clearly says TWC on it. The guy claimed that different modems work in different regions. I'm not sure if I'm buying it. Regardless, Arris should have done their homework and made sure it was compatible before they put the TWC name on the box.
customer_reviews.author: M-Schess

customer_reviews.title: Good modem, but beware of password during setup
customer_reviews.text: Have had the modem for five months now with no problems. Works much better than the Time Warner cable modem/router I replaced with it. One thing to be aware of is that the instruction manual that comes with the modem says that the setup username/password is admin/password, but for me it was actually admin/motorola. I only found out the correct password after downloading and reading the user manual from amazon (thankfully they have it up here). Otherwise it is a nice sturdy modem that broadcasts a wi-fi signal across both floors of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Facing Internet dropping issue
customer_reviews.text: I am a Comcast user, Max speed I am able to get 49mbps for download and 6mbps for upload. Though I have a plan from Comcast that I am supposed to get up to 100mbps. That's still fine. Now the problem I am facing is, the router is droping the internet connection very frequently. I am facing it since last 8-9 months. Particularly the 2.4 GHz band is dropping the internet connection for me most often. Probably need ARRIS customer service help.. let's see.
customer_reviews.author: Shibaram Sahoo

customer_reviews.title: I have Turbo (Which is in the middle) and I am getting about 350mb and up download speed and I am very happy. Would highly recom
customer_reviews.text: I order the product to get rid of my Time Warner router that was had awful WIFI range. Saved myself $10 per month and this modem works flawlessly. Remember if you have the highest internet service this modem will not handle the top bandwidth. I have Turbo (Which is in the middle) and I am getting about 350mb and up download speed and I am very happy. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Mc

customer_reviews.title: I have no complaints about the wired connection on this ...
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about the wired connection on this thing. However, the wifi connection is absurd. Our laptops (MacBook Pros) would constantly drop connectivity through wifi. My iPhone also had issues staying connected through the wife. During the period of time that we owned this thing we ended up using our cellular data more than our wifi internet because it was essentially unusable. I tried multiple settings for the 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz bands including optimizing the channels and power output. Nothing helped, not even a small bit.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry K.

customer_reviews.title: Great AC WiFi Connection
customer_reviews.text: This item works great! Especially if you live in a condo, apartment or somewhere where there are a lot of standard wireless N WIFI signals that can interfere with each other. To take advantage of the beamforming AC signal your peripheral must be able to accept the AC WIFI signal. If not then you will be on the usual wireless N and you will not see a difference. I paired this modem/router with a Netgear AC1200 WIFI USB adapter for my desk top and my speeds went from a very slow, hardly ever connecting 2.5 mbps to a whopping 80 mbps or greater connections and I have Comcast and I only pay for 50mbps!
customer_reviews.author: SuperSaiyanJesse

customer_reviews.title: Cable Modem/Router does not live up to expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February as I was moving into a new house and wanted to have my own cable modem/router rather than renting from Spectrum. I have had it in service for 3 months and it has been a disaster. The signal drops periodically and randomly and I have to reconnect to the device even though I am less than 6 feet from the cable modem/router. I initially presumed it was an issue with Brighthouse Networks not configuring the service properly but unfortunately after multiple service calls, I find the issue still persistent. I would like to return the device and get a new one even though it is over the 60 day limit.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Sreedhar

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this cable router/modem. Performs as advertised. I found 5G wireless performance especially good. Easy to setup, except for erxtended call to Comcast to complete 'activation'. This required multiple attempts by Comcast support (for no apparent reason). Device is on their list of supported/recommended products. Was advised by cable guy that this process only goes well if you buy or rent the device from Comcast (!).
customer_reviews.author: fogi bear

customer_reviews.title: Plug-n-play, as easy as it gets.
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that I would have to deal with customer service to configure this baby to its best but it was pretty much plug-n-play. Xfinity recognized the device instantly and activated it just like that. The Arris software for configuring the network is pretty good and although I'm an advanced user I felt like a lot of non advanced users would have found it easy to use too - it has a brilliant configuration wizard that walks you through the most important items very intuitively. Very very good for such a widely configurable machine.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: If your looking for bandwidth look no further
customer_reviews.text: This monster modem not only reaches the farthest corners of my house it also gets more bandwidth than what my is rated us at we have 50mbps and I get almost 60 downloading some stuff our old modem from Comcast could hardly reach my room through a couple walls about 20 feet away it also suffered alot in the bandwidth range but not this thing everyone in the house gets perfect speeds and it has a very nice management menu for those of us that like to tinker with settings and ports
customer_reviews.author: Justen H.

customer_reviews.title: Now I am using all my gadgets again and am pretty pleased. Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: the dual band option was what sold me. I had 6850 before but had to manually switch bands, however my internet slowed to a crawl with 2.5 band, so my phone, printer, and tablet had no internet so that I could use my main computer without issue. Now I am using all my gadgets again and am pretty pleased. Easy to install, easy to activate (if you get a competent Comcast rep... good luck with that), and net speeds are reasonable. No complaints whatsoev.
customer_reviews.author: insertwittyhandle

customer_reviews.title: Really good so far
customer_reviews.text: Really good so far. After sbg900 that never got produced any more, motorola made a few other all in one routers, the sbg6580 was supposed to be great but it tuned out to be just OK (lot of disconnections) I bought 3 of them for myself and 2 other people and everyone had issues with that. I threw it away a few weeks ago and got this new model - sbg6782AC. So far it has working great with really good signal strength. if it goes bad I will update this review of course. the only down side to it is that the unit itself is too big and white!
customer_reviews.author: Sina

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my parents
customer_reviews.text: My parents have been complaining that their wifi wasn't working as well and was getting disconnected so I sent back the modem they received from time warner and got them this one due to the good reviews. So far they like it but they did mention sometimes the wifi connection is a bit slow but it does the job. The modem itself is sleek and easy to connect. But that is all I can say as I'm not at their house on a daily bases to give you a full review. All I can say is, they are not complaining therefore I'm sure it's working out for them.
customer_reviews.author: Jungie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy setup, and good customer service. This was the latest advancement in cable internet modem routers when I purchased it. I used it for 6 months without issue then changed my internet service to dsl. This is a cable ONLY modem and router. My local cable, midco, accepted this as a modem. I kept it just in case we switched back because it worked so well.
customer_reviews.author: PickUp

customer_reviews.title: At Last, a User Friendly Motorola Surfboard
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation for an old dinosaur like me. No problems setting up security, just follow instructions. Previewing the videos on the Arris site was a big help. Linked up 3 laptops, 1 printer, 1 Bluray player and 1 TV with little problem (had to update printer installer from Brother) Throughput is considerably faster than my old SG900 Motorola (10 y/o) and so far no loss of signal or need to reboot unit. If it is as good as the previous I expect a long and blissfully uneventful product life. Previous still operational, but Windows based and we are a Mac household.
customer_reviews.author: Old School

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product - works great, high quality
customer_reviews.text: At first, i purchased a NetGear Nighthawk modem / router, latest model... It was dead on arrival- after trying to revive it for more than 1 hour with Comcast on the line, I hated it and I returned it. And then, I purchased this product- and oh my Goodness.. Such a big difference. I plugged it in, activated it, and voila- done! Maybe took total less than 15 minutes.. Although I did need to call Comcast, it was not the modem's fault. To summarize, this is an awesome well-built product that performs GREAT. I am having a very favorable experience.
customer_reviews.author: Design Guru

customer_reviews.title: If Issues will update
customer_reviews.text: So far it does everything it was supposed to. Really easy to set up with comcast just called them and gave the MAC address they set me up. Rep even said he was going to buy the same unit model. The distance is comparable to my Comcast modem/router... maybe a few feet more and a more consistent signal. I moved the modem and have to use wireless on my gaming pc but all speedtests have shown similar figures so yet to notice a difference. Will update if anything bad happens but hoping for smooth sailing.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: The Gold Standard for Modem/WiFi Router Combinations
customer_reviews.text: I recommend my Motorola Surfboard to everyone that asks. It looks elegant, works nonstop and has a further reach than the WiFi router my cable provider was renting to me. I like owning my own unit because it's a monthly savings that will pay for itself in a year and a half. I am able to stream shows from Hulu in a back bedroom that previously had no signal at all.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great Combination Cable Modem and Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: Installed for my daughter and it's a great combo-unit. Setup was easy. I purchased this unit to avoid paying Comcast modem rental every month so it will pay for itself in a little over a year. Xfinity Internet screams on this unit. Fastest Download I've ever seen, 180 MB/S. I kept most of the default settings. There's a lot of flexibility in here. It looks like I could setup a 10. network if I wanted for example but I left it on the 192. Only caveats are you that this is a larger unit than most and not (in my opinion) wall-mountable.
customer_reviews.author: VA Renaissance Man

customer_reviews.title: Spend your money on a better option.
customer_reviews.text: This router seemed to work fine for about two months. After that, it drops connections a couple times an hour. It also has numerous known device incompatibilities. During a google search last night, I discovered a large number of forum posts referencing the inability to connect Google Chromecast, Tivo, and several brands of phones to Arris router wifi networks. I gave it two stars because it is easy to set up, the dual band is a great feature, and it has a very good wifi range. But the inability to connect devices is a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Maneval

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The worst one I've ever had. Constantly dropping connections, then it's difficult to reconnect. Bought a range extender thinking that would help. I had never needed one before but thought I'd try. Didn't help because it kept dropping the connection to the extender. It was sitting 20 feet from it with direct line of sight. Gave up and bought a TP Link Archer. Now I can connect anywhere in the house and do NOT need the extender.
customer_reviews.author: Tropigal

customer_reviews.title: An excellent choice to replace our rented modem/wireless.
customer_reviews.text: Connections on our home wireless network would fail whenever the microwave was used. When the opportunity arose to upgrade the network I did research and chose this ARRIS modem router combination to replace the one we rented from the cable provider. I needed to do more research and work to correctly implement the ARRIS. Now, the problem with the microwave is solved, the wireless network is reliable. Additionally, I set up a guest network login that solved a recurring problem with support of our house guests. Now we have a simple password and restricted network access that is most suitable to our guest needs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Wills

customer_reviews.title: Get this one. Other one on Time Warner list didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different modem on Amazon and had a lot of trouble with my connection for about a year. Decided to buy this one instead and it worked perfectly immediately. Like a router should. Great speed now. Both if the modems were on Time Warner Cable's list of approved devices, but obviously I recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Known bug w/ Comcast service + MS xb live
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on using this for a microsoft xb live account on comcast service, stay away. Do the research on google first on a frequent disconnect problem. The first thing you'll find in the box is "STOP! Before returning this item, call technical support" - They are of no help (they are not even aware of their customer's issues that have been ongoing for over a year). There is no fix for this, i.e. port forwarding, enabling UPnP, etc.. It's a known issue without a fix. Save your time on returning it like I did.. get a different router.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Working exactly as described. The small manual that came ...
customer_reviews.text: Working exactly as described. The small manual that came with it did not have the correct factory default password. However the Arris website (and several others) gave the correct one. This may vary by specific product, etc. Once set up with your own password, will no longer need the factory one (Unless you lose yours and/or require a reset. No problems calling Time Warner to register the modem for cable access.
customer_reviews.author: John Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Its Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today so take this with a grain of salt. I cant see a problem with it. I had a slight problem managing my wifi, no connectivity issues though. The default password for managing the wifi was wrong so I called in and they gave me the new one. It was then a piece of cake. Its fast! If I have any problems I'll update this review. However considering the thousands of reviews this has I wouldn't worry too much.
customer_reviews.author: paulicious21

customer_reviews.title: SBG6782 with Atlantic Broadband (ABB) services in Florida
customer_reviews.text: Installed last week with Atlantic Broadband in south Florida. Am having awful issues with the equipment becoming non-responsive and the WiFi disappearing!! Apparently there are two versions of firmware (v8.4 or v8.6) and the later one resolves a number of issues seen in the earlier editions. My only wish is that the ISP (Atlantic Broadband) would update the firmware. Read more about it here and here:
customer_reviews.author: bluetreivan

customer_reviews.title: Ok when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I paid a lot of money for this but had repeated dropped internet. I can't say the problem is just with this modem because Comcast is famous for pushing out firmware updates that make the hardware unstable dropping connections. I only used this a for about two months because i needed a solid connection. I pay way to much for internet and hardware to have bad connections. short time and switched to a separate modem router set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Phatguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem/WiFi Router!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase from the seller!!! Works as advertised, getting 200MB down on only 8 channels WiFi AC 😁
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Lee

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use it with my situation :(
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it 😞, so I can't say how it lasted, but Hitex allowed me to return it within 30 days if I paid shipping. Seems to be as advertised. I couldn't use this with the internet/phone combo from Comcast even though my cable phone was already connected to my house phone jacks and the salesman said that it would work. It seems to be good and to have good specs. I'm really upset I have to downgrade to Comcast's bottom of the line router. Wish I didn't have to use theirs.
customer_reviews.author: C Bing

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it was on the Comcast list of accepted modems and had a high rating. Unfortunately after spending hours on the phone with both Arris and Comcast, we could not get it to work properly. We had to conclude that there was a firmware issue and the modem was not fixable. I had to request a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Robin M

customer_reviews.title: Great range and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Quick to set up and with Time Warner I got download speed of 97mbps. Range was excellent, didn't need any access point or range booster with this router. I could not give it 5 stars because my plan is for 200 Mbps and Time Warner's software prevents speeds greater than 100 Mbps from this device. Had to return to get a modem/router that Time Warner supports for faster devices. This is a times Warner issue not a fault of the product.
customer_reviews.author: SEMPER FI MOM

customer_reviews.title: This was the best replacement for my modem issued by my cable provider
customer_reviews.text: This was the best replacement for my modem issued by my cable provider. I love the look. It doesn't slow down my 50mbps speed at all. Love that it is dual 2.4 and 5ghz because my house dropped some signals from last one now I used 2.4 for further things and the speed is slower but it doesn't drop. Only real con is they gave me the wrong password in the box, but that was taken care of quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Always disconnects from the network. I have to reconnect every few minutes
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to install but it keeps disconnecting from the network. When I call to the Xfinity, my internet provider they said it is the problem with my device. When I call the Motorola Arris customer care, they said it is the problem with the internet provider. It is so frustrating to keep reconnecting to the wifi every few minutes. I tested with another router and it is working fine so the problem is with this modem/router!
customer_reviews.author: Jag Jd

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 3 years and the directional band continually dropped. I dealt with it be just switch to the other each time. I also had an apple tv hardwired and it constantly lost connection. This morning my internet stopped working. Went to check and the router won’t even power on. It is completely dead. All other items plugged into surge protector are functional. For $200ish I expect better than this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Engel

customer_reviews.title: A Good Looking Multi-Function Cable Modem and Wired'Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: A higher end combination cable modem and wired/wireless (2.4 GHz & 5 GHz) router. Bought to replace two individual units, one of which had failed. Easily setup versatile, capable of different configurations as needed by the end user. Designed with no exposed antennas, a vertical stance (similar to a mini-tower computer), good looking with openly visible indicators of operation.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Werner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing router/modem combination
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this router/modem combination. I did a lot of research and for the price and affordability this is perfect. Multiple computer sites have this ranked towards the top. Hook up was extremely easy and it also is nice looking. The installers loved the whote color and wanted to buy one for themselves.It would be a 5 star rating however the WPS pairing does not work. We had to manually enter the security code into all our devices.
customer_reviews.author: Nick DavisTop Contributor: Minecraft

customer_reviews.title: Great choice!
customer_reviews.text: This product is worth the money. Before i bought it I went thru two other cheaper models, but I had to return them since the wifi kept failing. Since I got this product, I never had a WIFI issues again. I have three smart TVs, 2 Tables, 3 laptops, and 3 smart phones; my family uses all devices at the same time and the WIFI is strong and fast. We live in a three level home and the WIFI is strong all over the house, patio and garage.
customer_reviews.author: MaGabriela

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time!
customer_reviews.text: Finally returning to Amazon after a Motorola tech rep literally told me to return to the vendor, they couldn't figure it out. After trying 2 different units, they can't get their modem to work with Xfinity, yet the inferior Cisco AND Arris modems rented out by Xfinity work just fine. I spent HOURS on the Phone with Arris/Motorola, to no avail. Wish I could give this ZERO stars. Thanks for nothing, Motorola!
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great. but that does not justify the poor function
customer_reviews.text: Should have NOT buy a two in one. Owned it for almost 5 months now. Every other day, i have connection dropped. Not because of my internet provider. not because of my devices (already troubleshoot). I always used a separate modem and router. thought this is cleaner - less clutter. wrong. as the modem is turned on all day, the two in one heats up the other. have to reboot all the time. Looks great. but that does not justify the poor function.
customer_reviews.author: JinSh

customer_reviews.title: ... modem/router for about 5 months and have been very happy. Handing the original back to Brighthouse was great ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this combo modem/router for about 5 months and have been very happy. Handing the original back to Brighthouse was great and the performance this far exceeds the Brighthouse unit. My wifi receiver buffers Pandora within a second or 2, where as before, it easily took 30 to 40. Streaming movies has improved dramatically and having dual bands helps with all the various items that connect to our network.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ivey

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, some experience is needed to tweak the settings. Yet, it worked flawlessly after a 10 minutes call with my ISP (Optimum). Moca+Wifi+Router+Cable Modem all in one is awesome! Saves on cables, adapters, power consumption and overall clutter. Delivery was a bit slow but not a complete dealbreaker.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Fleury

customer_reviews.title: Not as happy as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Bought in July of 2016 and having issues keeping devices connected. Comcast states the issue is with the Surfboard and to reset it, which works for a little bit but then we are back to the same issues. Since we haven't even had it for a full year it is becoming a problem since our ROI has not been met yet. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THEIR PRODUT
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THEIR PRODUCTS IT BREAKS EXACTLY 1 MONTH AFTER WARRANTY AND THEY GIVE YOU A RUNAROUND....THEIR MODEM IS GARBAGE. AND NO ONE WANTS TO TALK TO YOU THEY WANT MORE MONEY $40.00 TO EVEN SAY HELLO. THEY ARE SET OF DISGUSTING PEOPLE. GO WITH ASUS
customer_reviews.author: Dreamy

customer_reviews.title: Solid Preformer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an Arris Modem and separate wireless router, which always seemed to hang up, bog down, drop connections, etc. Couldn't really tell you if it was the modem or the router, but since getting this one, I have not had any problems other than when Comcast themselves would go down (more often than one would like btw...) - I have 25G speed internet, and regularly test at 28 - 29G via wired or wireless.
customer_reviews.author: jimb

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased, Fast with multiple computers, quick streaming.
customer_reviews.text: This new modem is working out really well for us. We have three computers, a smart TV (and watch Amazon & Netlix) and a tablet, all of those communication devices were bogging down our rented system from the cable company so we bought our own. Movie streaming on our devices was often extremely slow, a big problem for us We're very satisfied with this modem,,,,,when the grandkids come over with their tablets their should be no more complaints of 'taking too long' to load things.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Campbell

customer_reviews.title: it worked great for 28 days
customer_reviews.text: Well i'm on my second one. I bought it so I didnt have to rent one from Comcast, it worked great for 28 days! On day 28 I came home and had no wifi on my ohine some of the lights were still illuminated in the unit so I called. Comcast they tried to restart it and it didnt even turn off ao I unplugged it and then it would not come back on at all! Thank god it was before the 30 days so I could still return it. I received the second one, hoomed it up and is working great so far, Im hoping the last one was a fluke and this one doesnt quit on me.
customer_reviews.author: LOR

customer_reviews.title: The modem was great for the first year
customer_reviews.text: The modem was great for the first year. Unfortunately, the modem would interrupt my internet daily after the first year of use and I have to reset the modem every time the internet stops. It seems the parts go faulty after a year. I paid $125 for this modem originally to stop paying Comcast's modem rental fee, however if I have to buy a new modem again, I would have only saved $50 by using my own modem. If Motorola can make their products at least two years, they can market themselves as competitive alternatives to renting ISP provided modems. Please improve upon the quality of your products Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Top of the Line Product
customer_reviews.text: If you are in an area where you can get >100 Mbps Internet... This modem is fantastic. I am personally on a 300 mbps Comcast Super Blast Plan. I can use this modem and download a 30 Gb file in roughly 12 Minutes. Setup with comcast over the phone was simple. Up and running in under 30 minutes. For whatever reason, I get better performance on 2.4 ghz Wireless than on 5.4 ghz. But most or what I do is over hard line cat5 or cat6 anyway. Its pricey, but its also fast fast fast.
customer_reviews.author: OCDC

customer_reviews.title: The Amazon is a great reasonable site and I did not have any problem ...
customer_reviews.text: I owed that modem for six days and every single day I was on the phone or live chat with the Comcast analysts to get a help.The wire connection was OK but Wi-Fi did not work. I rebooted the modem myself numerous times and the Comcast analysts worked hard by boosting a signal and provisioning the modem It just did not work, so I returned the item. The Amazon is a great reasonable site and I did not have any problem with returning the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Constantly Resets and Not Worth Buying!
customer_reviews.text: Similar to other reviews for this product I bought it because I did not want to pay for a rental modem/router from Comcast. I wish I would have read more of the reviews on here because mine too would randomly reset constantly and thus not work correctly. Comcast came and confirmed that everything was "good on their end." I'm going to attempt to contact Motorola to see what they say but the warranty expired a couple months ago so I'm not very hopeful. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hubble Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Not Good For Larger Homes with Many Walls
customer_reviews.text: This modem/router combination did not work well at all for me. Sporadic (and frequent) loss of connectivity caused a great deal of frustration over a two week period. Tech support, although well meaning, was ineffective in resolving the issue. Replaced this unit with a Netgear (CM500) Modem and Netgear Router (R7000/AC1900) which works well (i.e. not a single loss of connectivity since installation).
customer_reviews.author: John
